page.title: 20THE CONTRIBUTORS
page.content: This block for the Domesday Book has been written by the members of the Old Headington Women's Institute. Originally started in Rural Areas, this is a women's group who meet monthly to hear an interesting lecture and for social intercourse. They are interested in the lives of everybody in the community and in broadening their educational horizons. The Women's Institutes are part of a National Federation which exerts influence on national politics by the Resolutions which they discuss once a year at the Albert Hall in London. The National Federation is affiliated to the Associated Countrywomen of the World.
